text: The brussel salad is delicious, the sprouts and kale are so tender and the parm cheese and bacon are a great addition. At lunch you can get a half sald and sandwich. I got the salmon lox which i would pass on next time. The reason for 4 stars is their servers are slow and forgetful..

So I stopped in because I'd been walking all day and wanted a beer, some water, and shade. What I got was a super knowledgeable and friendly bartender (Stephen) laid back atmosphere and some fun chats with the staff (it was pre-rush). And also many beers and delicious cheese curds :) They all take what they do very seriously and it shows. If I lived in this neighborhood this would be my go-to place. Thanks for making a visitor feel at home!

Absolutely awful service. I sat at the bar on the first floor and ordered brunch. After 25 minutes of not being checked on while other people were also ordering their food, I confirmed that my order was entered into the system. Another 25 minutes passed and I was told that my order actually was never entered. I asked for the check and was not even offered a sincere apology by the barista. Blue Door used to be one of my favorite spots, but the service has been slipping. This was the final straw and I won't be coming back.

I used to visit their BD Farm Stand Too so I was used to their take out only food service. I was glad they opened a full restaurant and was excited to try it out since they closed their small location. Menu is pretty much the same and service was real slow. We visited on a Friday night and they were not at all busy. There were only a few tables with customers. Our server was really nice but gosh awful slow. We only ordered two salads and it took forever and we had to get the hostess and ask her where our server was. The servers and hostess spent the night huddling at the door just talking away while I only saw one real server in the whole restaurant. The food was good, not much of a difference from their small location. I don't think I'll be coming back for a sit down dinner, I will be getting takeout from now on.  I do recommend the kale Brussels sprouts salad. It's super yum and they give big portions!

this place is simply great. All staff extremely helpful and friendly, the atmosphere & decorations were beautiful, and the food is really tasty. The ingredients seemed extremely fresh and healthy but also very decadent & hearty. and honestly the salads here the best I've ever encountered and that's saying a lot because I've eaten a lot of salads from a lot of different restaurants.

We had reservations for 4 at 1pm on a Sunday.  Seated promptly. Upstairs table, beautiful area.  Light fixtures, flooring, decor all perfect.  Casual atmosphere, wait staff on top of it. Our server, Kelsey D, did not disappoint.  Great service, waters refilled (we are big water drinkers) in a timely manner and orders arrived same.  Food was delicious. Ham Benedict cooked to perfection, not dry, just right.  Brussels and Kale salad with added salmon HUGE salad (took some home) could be split by two.  Also tasty.  Farmstand Cobb also large,  de-lish. All greens were fresh tasting, chiicken in the cobb was tender and juicy. Dressings on both salads were lite and refreshing, not overdressed.  This was our second visit, first time was just as stated above.  Great service and excellent food.  We will recommend and will return!
Good food to go but so slow! Said it would take 15 min, actually took 45. Need to pick up the pace, or at least be more realistic about the timing.

My first time at Blue Door Farm Stand! Amazing!  The food is so fresh and top notch! I honestly wanted the whole menu! I can't wait to go back. You will be pleased with the fresh taste of the food, amazing portions, and the service. Honestly, went during the day and it wasn't crowded, but I can imagine on the weekends this place is a hit, so just make sure to call! If you are looking for amazing service, please make sure you ask for Jeff! His upbeat personality and knowledge of the menu will make your dining experience amazing! I look forward to going back!

I am SO glad this place opened back up, just in time for me to move-in right down the street;).  I come in every week for a half to-go order of the Brussels & Kale salad.... and let me tell you, this thing is addicting. I have yet to try anything else on the menu because this dish is so good: loaded with slivered almonds, bacon, and a tahini dressing that is out of this world. One of these days I'm going to try their Fig & Arugula sandwich or one of their delicious baked goods, but for now..... No use fixing what ain't broken:)

They moved to a new space on halsted just north of armitage. Space is extremely nice. Waiter was a bit slow. Sandwiches are same as previous location but breakfast no longer served all day. Ends at 11  Star docked due to limited improvements

I went here with my husband today. The atmosphere was cozy. The hostesses were welcoming and sat us right away. We sat on the second floor which was very pleasant. I had the half sandwich and salad. The salad was made with Brussels and kale with bacon, almonds, etc., it was fantastic! I also had the turkey and cheddar with pepper jam which I've never had but enjoyed it. My husband had the burger and fries. The burger is a double burger with cheese and was very tasty. The fries were very fresh and good also. The portion sizes of everything were decent. Our server was friendly and helpful with questions. I would definitely eat here again!

Just visited Blue Door Farm Stand when my mom was in town visiting and I'm in love!   The Kale and Brussel salad is TO DIE FOR and the place is so cute, welcoming, delicious and suprisingly not too expensive.  Great place for lunch!

Slightly disappointed in Blue Door Farm Stand. It recently opened on Halstead and has tremendous curb appeal and a cute interior. We went here for brunch and had to wait about 10 minutes before a server came to our table to even take drink orders.  I ordered the basic brunch with scrambled eggs, hash browns, bacon, and pancakes. The eggs tasted wet and the hash browns were undercooked. The pancakes were definitely the highlight of the meal but only had 2 small pancakes. I would only get pancakes if I came back.
Great addition to the Lincoln Park neighborhood. Such a lovely space and the food is amazing. Perfect lunch spot. Need to try it for breakfast and dinner.

Loved the ambiance and decor in here.  Very warm and inviting.  Plus, they are called the Blue Door and actually had a Blue Door!!!!!  Staff was friendly, and the menu had a lot of appealing options.  We were basically here for a snack, but I would go back and try other items as they sounded good and looked good coming out to other tables.  We had cheese curds (light and fluffy, with really good, spicy banana peppers), plus ceviche (whole shrimp and scallop, not chopped like you usually see).  The cocktails were well received at the table for taste.   I would give this a four or five star except for two things:  price of beer (way too much when other places serve the same beers for dollars less) and speed of drink service (a beer shouldn't take 10 minutes to arrive, unless you're changing a keg, and if that is the case, come tell me immediately and I will 100% understand.  Same thing for cocktails.  We ordered and my beer came out first (late, but first).  We had to remind the waitress about our cocktail order, and they eventually came out.  Each cocktail order took at least 10 minutes.  Having the bar upstairs is fine, but they need to figure out how to not get drinks lost up there).

Very disappointed. Ordered food through the phone and the worker taking my order was incredibly rude.  Terrible sounding attitude, not helpful at all and just downright rude. It's unfortunate because they have amazing food but I will not going back.
My new favorite brunch spot! This place is adorable. I felt like I was on vacation! The decor, food and drinks were amaaaazing!

This is my first yelp review of a restaurant, ever.  I Live in California and I was visiting family in Chicago this week. I have worked in restaurants my entire life and I know when something special is happening. Blue Door Farm Stand is one of those places. I was just walking by and the lovely scent coming from inside grabbed my attention. I walked down Halsted and peeked into a few other establishments and I could not stop thinking about Blue Door. I went quickly back and sat at the counter/bar and I felt like family, right away, with Heidi, Tommy and Alana.  My lunch was memorable, to say the least. I had the Red Beet appetizer with some sort of tasty sauce underneath (I was thinking, maybe homemade Greek yogurt). It was amazing. I had their Seared Ahi Main Dish and I must say, it blew me away. I fish for Tuna regularly  and this tasted like I caught it off my boat and ate it on the spot. It was accompanied with the crunchiest/freshest green beans, cherry tomatoes and veggies imaginable, with a delicious green sauce. I also, felt like the portions were large, for the price. Considering the Lincoln Park location, it hits a home run. The decor is an architects triumph of: lighting, color and use of space. After my visit, I text all my relatives in the Chicago area and the Chef of my restaurant in California, to tell them of my experience. The Blue Door was on my mind all day/night after my first visit so, I went back again the next day for lunch and another go. Boy, was I happy again. For my second visit, I had the any 1/2 petite Salad(Kale and Brussels) with a cup of their Lentil soup. I must say, it was off the charts good, again. The 1/2 salad portion is surprisingly big and the lentil soup was delicious. They have great coffee (ask Heidi, I had like 4 cups) and their wine/beer selections are fantastic and hip/current. So, please take it from a life restaurant guy, support Blue Door Farm Stand and they can become a Chicago iconic place.
Great service, Fresh food and wonderful ambiance!  Kale and Brussels salad was on point.

Tried giving the new location a shot. We were greeted by three hostesses and sat promptly which was great. However, once we sat down, it took 10 minutes before even being offered water and several waiters/waitresses walked by our table without making eye contact for 6 minutes after that. So basically we waited a total of 16 minutes and then decided to get up and leave. I'd like to see this restaurant do well unlike most others that have opened in the neighborhood - hopefully they work on the service issues.

As soon as I walked in I was greeted em right away. There were 3 hosts and they were all very sweet. We engaged in conversation immediately until my table was ready. Once they sat me down someone approached my table and offered me water. I told him it wasn't necessary since I wouldn't be drinking it. About 7mins went by and someone tried to pour me water again, I explained t wasn't necessary- he then asked if there was someone else he was able to get me. I asked for an Arnold palmer easy ice. He told me he will get it to me shortly. About what felt like 10 mins later, he came back with my drink and asked to take my order. I asked for his suggests on salad and I went with it.  I ordered a hummus appetizer and then half sandwich and salad. I asked for hummus to come first and then my main shortly after.  It was a working lunch so I didn't mind the long wait time...for a hummus, something that gets plated with no preparation time.  It was alright, nothing special. When I saw how long it took to bring out, I spotted my waitlist and told him that he can put my meal through so it can come out whenever it's ready. Without hesitation he went and brought it. That simply told me it wasn't spaced out and everything was ordered together. My Ava sandwich was cold, it was good, but I'm sure it would have been better if it was hot.  The Brussel/Kale salad was delicious! I was very impressed with my main meal.  During the duration of my meal I received 3 Arnold palmers- each time only taking 3 sips per glass since it was all ice.  Once the check arrives I notice I was charged for 3 drinks. I was confused since refills are typically provided, there are only additional charges if served in a bottle.  When I pointed that out to the waiter his response is "everything was correct, we brew our own tea so there is an additional charge". Gotcha!  I will most likely be back since he food was great! The service, not so much! Sam, id suggest smiling a bit more and maybe checking up on your tables.

I have always enjoyed the food at Blue Door and was happy to see the new restaurant finally open.  The new space gets 5 stars. It's airy, attractive and spacious.  The oatmeal was watery and there was just a tiny portion, served with about 3 walnuts and some cranberries and brown sugar. I wouldn't have minded the boring presentation or even the portion size if it had been tasty. It was watery and had a funny off taste -- like refrigerator, I'm not sure. But it was unappetizing and I should have sent it back.  The fruit plate was pretty. There were two strawberries on it that looked like they came from a farm and they were tasty. But the sliced apples and oranges had the same weird flavor that the oatmeal did. Not appetizing at all and very disappointing.  The latte was good.  I've had good meals at Blue Door before and will likely go again. I hope they don't disappoint me.

My friend and I stumbled upon this place on 4th of July and it was perfect for a lazy lunch.  The ambiance is open and airy.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.   We had the hummus starter, dried cherry/pecan salad, and club sandwich.  Everything was very good and simple.  We ended with the chess pie, which was phenomenal.  I will definitely be back especially because the service and staff were excellent.

Better than Summer House santa Monica (down the street).  Food was excellent, had the kale salad and chicken sliders, both were 10/10.   Prices are a little high but not silly, in line with the competition.   Decor and menu are both very good, it's a nice place but not overly fancy, decor is fresh and tasteful.   Big open doors to let in the fresh air.  I will go many more times.   Very much recommend.  They would be very wise to offer mid-week happy hour specials for locals that would otherwise not go at early or off times.

This place is very quaint and beautiful! My waitress was very attentive and helpful, drinks were good, food was good. And they source all their food from local farms (aside from some speciality items). I would definitely recommend this place!

Hmm not sure what I just paid for. I took a to-go order for the Farm stand Cobb salad and I initially walked in with high expectations because of their remodeling and "upgrade"; however, sadly I wasn't impressed with my meal. First off, I found not one but two giant ass flies in my salad which I immediately found revolting. And secondly, they changed their menu and it used to be a fresh spinach arugula greens, red and orange peppers, chicken, blue cheese, and eggs. Instead I got low quality greens, few yellow hot peppers, chicken, blue cheese, eggs, and two flies. Oh! Plus they raised the price on it.
The new restaurant is fantastic, my daughter and I enjoyed a delicious lunch with great service. We've already invited some friends to join us there for dinner soon.

YEAH!  You opened today and boy, have i missed that vanilla late you guys make oh so well. New place looks amazing, we'll see you tonight for some dinner and tasters on what you've been cooking up since the closing, relocation and now opening! Nice meeting the partner, Gabe.

OMG I can't type fast enough!!! My boyfriend's dad was visiting from Portland and was craving a salad. We yelped around and found this spot. Got there. Sign on doors said "training in progres closed today". We were sad but noticed a guy on the phone who looked like he worked there.  Dad being a dad told him he had driven 1000 miles just for this salad and the guy ended up being the President/owner of the restaurant and let's us dine on 3 amazing salads for FREE! And We had the whole restaurant to ourselves!!! Most amazing salads, amazing President, and awesome managers and staff.  Eat here. You'll love the salads.

It seems they can't make up their mind where they want to be physically located..? I think they've been at three, maybe four, different locations. I couldn't find their second location previously (I guess google/other social media had not bed. Updated). Just went to the present location and hours said they were open tried the door and it was locked. There were a bunch of people inside and when I called no one answered. No sign on the door. Overall update: may recommend to others but can't say I'll make a special trip out here for them again.

Ordered takeout from Caviar and was not disappointed. I had a turkey sandwich, husband had the Italian sandwich and we split a side of broccoli salad and chopped salad. There was enough food for dinner and two lunches. Everything was flavorful and fresh. Would definitely order from them again.
My favorite salads in the city. I want everything on the menu every time I go and I'm never disappointed with what I get. Delicious baked goods too!
This place is amazing! Perfect place to pick up a sandwich & salad combo.

The food is pricey but everything I have tried there has been great. The salad/sandwich combo gives you a good amount of food and is a decent deal for the high prices. The carrot cake is also delicious.  The staff is always very friendly and speedy.

Okay so as I'm impatiently waiting for the *actual* restaurant location to open on Halsted, I stopped by this location after a walk. I didn't get a sandwich or a salad, but I saw those carrot muffins and couldn't resist. Easily the best carrot muffin I've ever had in my life. I could've eaten 5 more of them. Blue Door Farm Stand, keep doing you!

The cashier lady with that beautiful Alabama accent, so charming that i up the stars by one for a full five. Delicious salad. Good sandwich.  WOW - that carrot cake --- delicious and so big.....Y'all made me fat.

Great little shop with quality sandwiches and salads. Priced a little higher than what I normally would pay for lunch but the food was good and the staff was great! I will come back when I visit again. This is my friends goto daily.

The food was good a little too overpriced for me. I had the roast beef panini sandwich. The sandwich was good but I definitely think they could add a little something extra to this sandwich as far as other ingredients besides beef and cheese to make it stand out more. Other than that the sandwich was OK.

Do NOT go to this place if you have any allergies.  They seem to use the menu as a general guide but definitely not as any kind of rule book that you can depend on as to what is or isn't in your food.  Thankfully I don't have severe allergies so them giving me stuff not on the menu gives me some tummy issues.  I would never go back there again.
Delicious big salads with fresh ingredients... Wish they had an unsweetened iced tea option..

I only allow myself to eat out for lunch once a week; and, with all of the options around, I somehow always choose Blue Door. Everything that I have tried is absolutely phenomenal. My favorite is the roasted beet and farro salad. It is so amazing and so filling. The serving size is large enough to split into two meals (although sometimes I can't help myself and eat the entire thing). The delivery is also amazing. Sometimes it arrives in nearly 15 minutes! Love this place! Keep up the good work!

This place offers fresh ingredients and big portions, but in return you have to pay the price. I was very surprised when my salad was over $14 with tax and tip, but even more surprised when it arrived in such a big box. I ordered the Sesame Chicken salad, and I munched on it happily for most of the next 30 minutes. The sesame cilantro vinaigrette the salad came with complemented the pickled portions of the salad perfectly, and there was a generous amount of chicken. As others have pointed out, this is only a takeout place - don't be like me and sit on one of the two benches they have because you didn't check beforehand!

I didn't realize this was a takeout-only place (luckily Yelp has changed the listing since). The only seating includes 2 benches for customers while they wait for their carry-out.  I had the Ava grilled cheese & it was BOMB. The flavors complimented each other really well. It came with a side of potato salad, which was decent, but nothing to write home about.  I'll definitely be back!

This place is delicious! I usually get the half kale/ Brussels salad and half the fig arugula grilled cheese. It could use more cheese but still delicious. Wish the actual restaurant would open back up already!

I came here for the well-reviewed fog and arugula grilled cheese sandwich. Honestly, the sandwich was fine, not fantastic but definitely not bad. What was bad was the fact that there was a piece of plastic in my sandwich.

I order almost every day from this place. I get the Kale Salad and it's insane. It's better with bacon, but lately I have been trying to make it a little more healthy going sans the good stuff. I've had sandwiches from here too. everything is delicious. I think I pay their electric bill with the amount of money I spend here on a monthly basis haha
Got the Brussels sprout salad and a grilled cheese delivered. It was so good even for delivery! Well packaged and still hot. *Tip* add chicken to the salad--its heavily spiced and delicious!
Great service! Super nice employees! Food was awesome and my order was ready for pickup in like 5 minutes. Definitely will be coming back here again

I have tried to like this place. I've been here three times now and I will say that the soups are always outstanding..,, but every single time I get a sandwich it comes out soggy and just a hot mess. This time I got the grown-up grilled cheese which was supposed to have basil on it, but it had one tiny tiny piece of basil and a bunch of cheese and not very nice looking tomatoes and it was soggy. The same thing happened the last time I got the grilled cheese with roast beef. I just don't understand. This is a takeout place so stuff has to be able to hold until you get it to wherever you're going. And there's really nothing yuckier than a soggy wet grilled cheese sandwich.  For 12 bucks. I won't be coming back.

This review is for a take out order My friend has been raving about the kale and Brussels sprout salad , finally ordered it as a take out . They asked if i wanted the dressing on the side or tossed, i said tossed . Not a good idea Flavors were great but Wow was there way to much dressing on it! I actually had to squeeze it out if the kale and transfer bowls. My friends was the same way  Id give it another try but definitely recommend getting your dressing on the side

I discovered Blue Door Too a little more than a year ago and ever since I have eaten it two or three times a week. The AVA grilled cheese and Brussel Sprout Kale salad are amazing. However, during the last month the food hasn't been as consistently good as it usually is. I don't know if they got a new chef or what. All in all, wonderful to-go healthy food!

Absolutely love this place. It's so my go-to 'fast food' place - hands down. Their ingredients are always fresh, the prices are totally decent - even though they have increased slightly? Definitely a must try.  I recommend the sesame chicken salad and the Ava (grilled cheese). Always ask what their soup of the day is. It's seasonal and usually very yummy.

I love this place. The staff is sooo friendly, Alex helped me out and he was amazing. They made accommodations with my order without any issues. The BK salad is out of this world. Make sure u try this place out!!

ordered from amazon prime now and it was delivered so quickly! such an easy process.   the kale salad was delicious! crisp kale and brussels sprouts, perfect amount of dressing. also ordered a tuna sandwich and grilled cheese (Ava). grilled cheese was a little too sweet for my liking but overall we really enjoyed and will definitely eat here again!
Wife and I ordered a turkey sandwich, kale salad, lentil soup and grilled cheese from Uber Eats. We were blown away at the deliciousness. Very high quality. Can't wait to get more!

My first (and will be my only) experience here: The employees were rude and impatient with me when I asked a simple question about what oil they cook with, as I try to avoid GMO canola oil as often as possible. One employee was short with me when I inquired about their cooking oil, and finally told me they use crisco olive oil. I was very patient and nice the whole time there, btw.... despite their irritated, rude attitude toward me. They made me feel uncomfortable and embarrassed for even asking about their food and ingredients, which is not good customer service... When my to-go order was ready (thinking it was prepared w/ 100% olive oil), I asked the person who handed it to me about the cooking oil, just to double-check, and he also was rude to me. He said "we don't cook with olive oil...." Turns out they cook with GMO canola oil. Didn't even get to eat my meal. So disappointed with this place. From reading about it online beforehand, I thought they had very high standards for all of their ingredients, since they do use some local produce and dairy.  It's not like it's cheap food either, so I can't wrap my head around their unprofessional attitude and bad customer service... my meal was over $11 and I only got 1 food dish. Never going back!
I paid over $10 for a sandwich that wasn't even toasted???? A coldcut sandwich with some cold pieces of cheese???? Disgusting. I'm from NY where that would never happen.
Love the asian chicken salad and really good french dip.  My kids love the kids' options too. They also deliver through a bunch of apps and always shows up cold and fresh.

This place is great - the food is delicious and the staff is friendly. Unfortunately though, they are wildly inconsistent. As a tip to the restaurant, please start measuring. I get the Kale and Brussels salad regularly, and it hasn't once been the same. The ratio of kale and Brussels sprout is always different. Sometimes my salad is loaded with cheese, bacon and almonds - other times I am digging to find any additional topping. The dressing is never the same either. I really love Blue Door, but I can't keep paying $12 if I don't know what to expect of my meal.
Great food , freshly made . Great selection of sandwiches , soup, salad . Would recommend veggie wrap And a kale salad .
These sandwiches are to die for.  Quick fast and prompt to go service.  They even do Uber Eats and others for city delivery.

We were so excited to try this place when we were in Chicago. The food sounded creative and fun.  There was nobody in there when we walked in. My mom and niece placed their order and had their food within a few minutes. We placed our order for our family of 4 immediately after my mom did. A couple minutes after placing our order a gigantic group of about 20 people entered the building. None of these people had ordered ahead. About 12 (TWELVE!!!!!!) of them received their order before ours. We waited until about the 10th person received their order, 20 minutes after we ordered ours, to politely ask if ours was ready. They rudely said it would be another few minutes. After a few more minutes and a few more other people's orders went out, they finally gave us ours. Not a word was uttered. She just passed us our bag. No apology. Nothing.  We will never be back. Plus, your food was gross from the cauliflower soup to the fig sandwich.
Love it here! Foods so good and always so fresh! Their soups are alway so tasty. Wish they had a larger portion of it.

I loved this place but it has significantly declined - I just waited over 30 minutes and there was no apology from anyone why it took so long. I asked 2 times - they said they are busy but made no effort to try to correct the situation.

Friendly service and great food. I ordered a grilled cheese and soup on a day when I was home sick from work and it was ready in 10 minutes. The bread on the grilled cheese was amazing, as was the combination of cheese and bacon - I got the Ava. The lentil soup was very tasty as well, good seasoning and flavor. Again the service and convenience of this place is top notch!
The Fig and Arugula grilled cheese is amazing! And the pear and ginger juice is also delicious!
I love the chicken salad!  It has a twist on your traditional mayo-nut-grape chix salad: smokey!  So yummy.  My only complaint: please open the restaurant bakery already!!!

I was walking by and saw they had a ginormous carrot cake. I needed to eat some veggies so I thought... hummm.... carrot cake counts right? Omg!  I have never in my life had a carrot cake this amazing. It was a moist, juicy and not too sweet. It also was I believe, three or four layers. It was so decadent. So if you're in the neighborhood and you want to have more vegetables I suggest you order a slice of their amazing carrot cake. , hands down it is the best. On customer service: their customer service is spectacular. The quality of the food is amazing. I cannot wait to return.
So excited to have a "grab and go" option for this delicious and healthy restaurant. I hope they stay open at this location when the new dine-in is open!

I popped in here one morning to grab some lunch to take to the office.  The inside has a nice ambiance.  I ended up going with the half and half, soup (Carrot and Pepper)  and salad (something with shaved brussel sprouts, kale, bacon, and cheese).  It is served warm and was hands down, the best salad I have had in a long time.  Absolutely delicious.  They have Izze sodas and cakes (the latter of which took great restraint to pass up... it was just sitting there, in all of its carroty cakey goodness).  Will definitely be back.

I just ordered Postmates delivery Blue Door Farm Stand and after stuffing my face, I could not get to Yelp fast enough to review. Everything I had was amazing, all the way down to the crust on the bread. We ordered the brussell spout salad-yum!, fig&arugula grilled cheese-double yum!, veggie wrap-yum!, and the farmhouse sandwich-yum!. I will absolutely be visiting again.

Brussel salad is to die for!  Be prepared, you will get addicted.  :)  All of the sandwiches are unique and delicious! We have ordered from Caviar and our order is quick, delicious, and always correct.
Fast, delicious, healthy and competitively priced. This place has turned into an unexpected go-to take out place since it appeared. Love the huge salads and the soups are delish. Highly recommended.

The Brussels and kale salad is perfection. Between the amazing grilled cheeses and hearty soups I think it's impossible to have a bad order here. Best fast farm to table concept in the city, hands down.

This is my favorite place in the city to get lunch. The ingredients are farm fresh, the staff is very friendly, and most importantly, the food tastes great! I would recommend anyone stop by for a meal if you are in the Lincoln park area.

Wow....all the magical magnificence of the original in a more convenient (for me) location!  Right across the street from Lincoln park high school, super easy to park.  If your not familiar, this is possibly the best "farm" food in Chicago.   Incredibly creative, yummy, and priced perfect. Easy lunch options, soup/salad/sandwich combos!   As an added rare bonus, EVERYONE here is nice!!!
I'm so happy Blue Door Farm Stand 'Too' is back. Fig & arugula grilled cheese. Enough said.

WOW! The salads here are amazing. They are so filling and look very appetizing. Im not really a salad type of girl, but if you are looking into eating something healthy, this is the place. The sandwiches are very creative and well put together, the ingredients go well. The cashiers are always friendly. Love it!

I like food here. But the cashier was not very friendly.. Food ingredients, concept, decor are nice. I would probably go back sometimes... Kids menu is pretty good. Any sandwish or salads are good. Bit pricy as order service, meaning no waiter service place.

You know what grinds my gears?  Walking over to a restaurant that appears open on Yelp, on their website, and has a working phone number, only to find that they are not open for business - on a day when the temperatures hit 90 degrees.  BDFS, you really need to put a note on Yelp or on your website OR add a recording to your phone number advising those who call that you're not open for business right now.

I ate here once and it was the only thing I ate all day-- I ended up with violent food poisoning that night. I called the next day and the manager was nice to me and offered me a free item for if I wanted to come by again. I ended up stopping by and getting a cold pressed juice (usually $6-7) but found out after reading the fine print on the back that I couldn't drink it because there's risk for people with weakened immune systems. All of that being said, the french dip sandwich that I had really wasn't that great. The restaurant's got a very "hipster" feel. You drink out of mason jars and eat on cutting boards. But I don't know, there's something about puking your guts out that makes you not trust/like a place. Definitely cute, but don't get the french dip.

I have only been to this place once, but I absolutely loved it! The decor inside is adorable and I love all of the fresh options. BUT...does anyone know when they are opening their new location!? I want to go back!
Their Kale Salad and Grilled Cheese are life changing!!! Will always come back, when will they be open on Halsted??? I'm waiting patiently!

I'm a big fan of Blue Door. From the shabby chic decor to the farm fresh menu and laid back style, I feel at home here. Also, who doesn't like them some fresh cheesy apps, am I right? I tried both the goat cheese fig crostini and the burrata bruschetta. I love love LOVE that they pile on the fresh cheese--both goat and mozz with that great farm to table freshness and potency, paired with some crisp and savory bread. The goat is wonderfully sharp, accompanied by a nice and subtle fig sweetness. The burrata is wonderfully soft and literally melts in your mouth. My husband and I also shared the Farmhouse Club, which was spot on, exactly what I needed and craved. I'll definitely be back for more of some o' that Blue Door country home pizazz.

Such a cute lunch spot!  Kale salad was amazing; dressing is light but packs lots of flavor, bacon is a perfect touch!  Also try the carrot cake! It's about a 1/4 of the cake--plenty--and super fresh. Best carrot cake ever.
Great restaurant and much needed casual food in LP.  Only negative is that there can be a long wait for lunch on the weekends.
Love it!  Sad when they closed to move.  Can't wait to try new location.
The Brussels and Kale salad is INCREDIBLE. They have great sandwiches, salads, and soups and you can do 1/2 1/2 combo orders with anything on the menu. Reasonable prices for quality too!

I love Blue Door's interior and menu! It's a great spot for lunch or even getting some work done. Their menu is quite extensive so coming back here would never be a bore. My favorite item here is their lentil soup. It's one of the best I've had to date with the perfect blend of herbs. I also really loved their turkey sandwich, though the one I had isn't on their menu anymore it seems. It is a bit pricey for the amount of food you get, but quality is top notch so I guess you are paying for that. The front of the shop has some local items for sale if you are interested in that.
There aren't too many vegetarian options but the wrap and kale salad are fantastic! The atmosphere is adorable! The service isn't very great, but the food is delicious!

My husband and I stopped at Blue Door on Memorial Day for lunch. Granted it was a holiday, so we knew it would be crowded, however, the service was so poor that it affected my rating. We arrived around 12:30, and the line was all the way back to the door. Why? 1 person at the register. We then waited for a seat, not because there weren't seats open, but all the seats that were open had dirty plates and cups on it because no one was cleaning them up. Eventually we just took a spot and after 15 minutes they cleared the space. Gross. Finally, after 25 minutes of waiting for a tuna sandwich and turkey sandwich, my husband's was delivered. 10 minutes later, after he had finished his, my meal showed up. No apologies, just thrown on the table. The food was good, but nothing to get excited about after waiting so long. I won't be returning, unless maybe its like 3pm on a week day when even the worst service should be able to handle the off-hour.

Blue Door Farm Stand is a little piece of the country side in the middle of a big city. Brunch is quaint and lovely, and everything is so fresh.  I had the greek yogurt bowl with berries and homemade granola drizzled with honey, and I could not have been more pleased. The atmosphere is something special in that it feels a little slower than the city outside. The staff is so accommodating and so so kind.
Great menu and done well! Loved the roasted beet and farro salad with arugula. The fig and arugula grilled cheese was a little spendy for what you get, but still very delicious.

Things I love: 1. cute interior 2. brussels and kale salad 3. roast beef french dip 4. option for a beer or cocktail with my meal 5. the deceptively delicious mini side of pasta salad that comes with the sandwiches Things I don't love: 1. speed and level of service 2. attitude of some staff 3. $9.50 for fresh pressed juice... for reals Honestly, the food is so so so good and is easily worthy of 5 stars.  I've tried a million times and a million ways to replicate the brussels and kale salad, but Blue Door has the market cornered.

I have been to this place a few times, so I am pretty well versed in their menu. Overall I like coming here because its convientint and you know you will get a good lunch meal. I would recommend that if youre looking for quanity to go with a salad. They are delicious and give you a lot of bang for your buck. I preffer their turkey sandwich with melted cheddar and straberry jam. My only gripe is that it was a little pricy for the amount of money. Overall will be back soon.

BDFS was shockingly crowded which is probably why my friends and I stopped inside to grab a bite to eat on a recent Saturday. BDFS has a rustic feel. Its the kind of place where drinks are served in Mason Jars. Additionally, BDFS is the kind of place that serves amazing food. Try any grilled cheese because they are amazing. The sandwiches were huge and delicious. Also, BDFS has an unusual, homemade Bloody Mary I suggest people check out. If you are okay with waiting in line, then wait in line at Blue Door Farm Stand.

Absolutely love the food here -- wonderful salads and delicious sandwiches. The Brussel and kale salad is one of the best salads I've had. However, on the past three times I've gone here, each time something the staff does makes me a little turned off to the place. I heard two staff members talking about a third, have heard staff complaining about customers and also staff members fighting with each other about duties/yelling at each other to get things done. If the employees can get their act together and present a better front to customers, this place gets 5 stars no question. That's just stuff that needs to be dealt with off the clock. This also doesn't mean there aren't wonderful employees here, but it's just what I've witnessed.

This is a really good spot/ really like the rustic interior of the joint!  Basically it's a farm to table cafe with like 10 sandwich/ 5 salads on the menu.  They also have tons of baked goods such as cookies & muffins/ coffee, smoothies, etc.  The farmhouse salad is absolutely amazing, one of the best salads I've ever had with the basil vinaigrette!  On the other hand, the grilled cheese I tried was not so good.. undercooked and not much inside.  It's always busy and def a bit on the pricey side so be prepared! get dat did

It was my first visit here one Sunday afternoon around 2pm. The wait was about 10-15 minutes to find a table (seat yourself) for 4. One orders at the counter and they give you a number (a very cute wooden block with the number on it) to set down on the table. They bring the food out to you and then take the number away once your order is completed . It took less than 10 minutes for the food to come out. The food tasted fresh and delicious. The only disappointment was that they were out of their cold press juices so I couldn't try it. I would recommend this place. I've tried other farm-to-table type restaurants, and this is my favorite place.

Loved this place the moment I walked in! It's super tucked in between buildings so we almost missed it on our way but when we walked in, the first thing that struck me was the interior design. Wooden floors, simple aesthetic - definitely had a "yuppy" feel.  I only got a juice from here (Green Juice #4), which is actually the first time I've ever had a green juice of any kind, and it was delicious! Definitely a little herb-y but sweet enough that it was still very tasty.  My friends and I sat at a small table and chatted for a good hour and a half or two hours and there was a constant bustle around the place. The servers brought my friends' meals to our table on cute wooden platters and they said everything was great - light but filling at the same time.  I hope to be back very soon for some real food in the near future!

Really great cafe spot to go to if you're in the area. Plenty of healthy, light options and I love that they carry my favorite coffee now (Bow Truss!). My only wish would be if they could change their juice supplier to Owen & Alchemy.. The current juices they carry are a little bland and don't taste so great but not really a reflection of the cafe itself since they purchase these from a separate company. Just wish they'd carry something a little more tasty like OA :)

Amazing!!! If I lived in Chicago, I would eat here every single day. I got the kale and Brussel sprout salad which was a 10! Absolutely delicious.. Love the decor, farm to table, and staff was so friendly!  Only thing I wasn't so in love with was that they were out of most green juices by the time lunch rolled around! Oh well, the food made up for it

Overall, the food is excellent and the staff is very friendly; however, the staff still seems to be working out some kinks. After several visits, we still notice small misses (partially wrong order, not following a specific instruction for an order, etc). The positives far outweigh the negatives here though and if they work out those kinks, this could be a 5 star place.

I love this place! Great sandwiches and salads with a cozy atmosphere. Staff is always friendly and it's never too busy. This is one of my favorite places near me to grab lunch or dinner with a friend, or something quick when I'm by myself.

Wow. Talk about tastey. I ordered the Grill Cheese Fig & Arugula and Brussels and Kale Salad. You can do half of each for $11, but I regret not doing a full one of each because that's how good it was. The grill cheese was very savory, that fig in it was the best, and now I'm going to start putting fig jam in my grill cheese.  I don't like Brussel Sprouts, but the Brussels and Kale salad was amazing, w/e dressing they put in it was awesome.  The cool thing about this place is they have a map of IL and MI where they where all their food comes from. It's a very rustic feeling inside, wood tables, homely bathrooms,  big bottles of glass water. The only problem with this place is the heat. It was like 15 degrees warmer in here than it was outside and it was 65 degrees out. Their kitchen gives off a lot of heat, and I left smelling like a kitchen, even 1 day later my coat still smells. Oh well. #worth.  Also for dessert we got the carrot cake and split it 3 ways. It was amazing, can't go wrong, and it's all MASSIVE, so you definitely need to split it multiple ways.
probably the best cobb salad i've ever had. so yum! i'll definitely be coming back.

A lot of restaurants are trying to swoon customers with words like "local", "farm-fresh" or similar terms but this place actually means it. I love knowing where my food is coming from and they can actually tell you.  The decor is perfect. The vibe is casual and calming. Everything is done excellently. They have dotted every I and crossed every t.  And the food. My goodness. I had to pause after every bite of dinner. I split a Kale & Brussels salad and the Fig & Arugula grilled cheese and both were incredible. I couldn't find anything wrong with it. So, I went back the next morning for an iced mocha and banana bread and it met every expectation. I love this place. Too bad I am not from Chicago or Blue Door would totally drain my bank account.

Very cool and simple atmosphere.  Started with the Burrata Bruschetta.  This was simply better than almost anywhere else I have tried in the city.  Hands down a great small bite. The Farmhouse Club was a great classic sandwich which was done to perfection.  The serving size was huge and thus making it a great value.  Has to be my new favorite spot to get a sandwich.

The kale salad is to die for, only taking 1 star off because it takes forever to get your food on the weekend (like 30 minutes), but they are getting a new location, so perhaps that will speed things up

I visited for the first time on Saturday afternoon. The food was great but the environment wasn't that great.   Food- I ordered the strawberry salad and fig and arugula sandwich.  Both were excellent. Environment - the seating is open, with several community tables.  Unfortunately, the line was long and my friend and I ended having to sit with two moms with little children.  It wasn't what we expected and we were constantly interrupted.  Yes....we could have waited for a table but that would have taken another 20 minutes.   Post lunch - our clothes stunk!  P-U!  My friend emailed me later and had the same experience too.  ick!

Came here for brunch over the weekend--the place is super spacious and looks like it came straight out of a DIY/rustic Pinterest board (in the best way possible). Think flowers in mason jars, water in mason jars, empty mason jars....and tons of quirky gadgets in all the right places. So while the food was alright, I have some reservations: 1. The breakfast menu is rather limited, and ends by noon! Pretty sure the brunch gods mandate that nobody be at a restaurant before 12 pm. 2. The sandwiches are pretty good, but I ordered one with a coffee and ended up paying $18--whaaaaa? Although these two things rather irked my brunching experience, the staff was super friendly and we spent quite some time there without being bothered. This place seems to be more suitable for lunch, for which I likely would have been more satisfied...thus, 4 stars.  However, if you're looking for some traditional brunch without paying for a pretty penny, I'd look elsewhere.

I love this spot! If I lived/worked closer, I would be here all the time for lunch. I've been a few times for lunch/brunch, and I've been impressed with the quality of food and the overall selection. The atmosphere feels rustic chic (if that's even a thing), and they have some houseware/cookbook items to browse in the entryway area. A good spot to grab a delicious bite, coffee, snack, or host/hostess gift!

Really somewhere between 3 and 4 stars. Came here on an early Saturday afternoon with the boyfriend after reading awesome reviews, hoping to get a sorta quick, delicious lunch. Things were pretty busy, but we don't mind waiting in line to order, and know eventually we'll make it to the food. . . except when we finally get to order, the cashier tells us it will be about 30 - 40 minutes to get out food out.  But, we really wanted to try this place, so we get some banana bread (so good) to snack on while we wait.   After awhile, we start to notice that although food is coming out of the kitchen, no one around us is getting their orders; things in the kitchen must have been seriously backed up.  Then, oddly, one of the bussers tries to take our silverware and napkins, even though we are clearly still waiting for food (we have the little cafe number right in front of us).  After I tried to stop him, he gave me back my knife and fork, but since he had grabbed them by the tops instead of the handles I would really rather he had just taken them - I'm not going to eat with that fork now.   Anyway, eventually (I think the wait actually ended up being more like 45 minutes) we got our sandwiches, and they were pretty good.  And I have to say I really enjoyed the Red Bell Pepper juice.  But, not quite enough to make me wait that long again.  Maybe I'll come back at a less busy time of day.
Food is great here. Fresh and creative. I was not fond of how a situation was handled after they got my order wrong... But in the end, the great food distracted me from feeling totally devalued.

I've been going here for months, and every time I am less and less impressed. Initially, I thought the food was great and easy to pick up on my lunch breaks. However, some of the managers seem to think it is ok to bark orders at their employees, and treat them with disrespect in front of customers. I find this extremely rude and it puts a bad taste in my mouth. I don't like to see when a manager only delegates tasks that they could obviously do themselves. I hope this changes because I enjoy the grown up grilled cheese and their sesame chicken salad.  Definitely avoid this place on weekends as well, because it is a zoo filled with tiny crying children who throw their food on the ground, which employees leave there for hours. I'm pretty sure this is considered unsanitary.  I hope in their new Halsted location that the quality will go back to what it was when I discovered this place in June.

I'm obsessed with the kale & brussel sprout salad.  It is expensive but you get a huge portion and feel healthy eating the whole thing.  I've tried the chicken salad sandwich as well; it was tasty but I'm a traditionalist when it comes to chicken salad so I wouldn't order it again.  I want to come back here to dine-in as everything on the menu looks so good.  The only reason I regret not living in Lincoln Park anymore is this place!!

All of the grilled cheeses are worth trying! the kale and brussell sprout salad is very popular as well. They have awesome Bloody Mary's on the weekends. Great atmosphere and decor. The only downside to this place is that when you leave the heavy smell of food lingers on you for awhile.

I really like this place. Good, nutritious breakfasts & lunches. I, like countless others, am a fan of the kale/Brussels sprouts salad with tahini dressing. All the sandwiches I've tried here are very tasty, and on the best bread, which makes all the difference. My one complaint is the exhaust system/open kitchen.  As much as I like eating bacon on my salad, I would prefer that my coat did not smell like bacon for days and days.

Blue Door Farm Stand is such a cute little spot and a great place to grab lunch with a friend. Their salads are my favorite-colorful, beautiful, HUGE and delicious-The Cobb, Brussels & Kale, and Sesame Chicken are my favs. Great spot on Armitage makes it very easy to do a bit of walking and shopping when you're done!

5 for decor/ambience. The rest was just mediocre. The prices are pretty high for the quality. Grilled sandwiches are way too crunchy for my liking and juices were not as tasty and refreshing as I thought they would be (and crazy expensive!) Was a little disappointed they charged me for a full salad and full sandwich when I specifically asked for half sandwich and small salad. Since I didn't realize the mistake until the food came out, I decided not to make waves (I was with other people including two children) and just kept it.  Wasn't offered an apology and was instead handed a to-go box for the extra food I was bound to have after my meal... Really??

More of a 3.5. Came Saturday for lunch and place was popping. After some confusion, boo and I realized we had to order first and then seat ourselves, in which servers brings us our orders. After ordering, we waited a bit but luckily snagged two seats at the bar top, in front of all the sandwich-making. I like the idea of the communal table they have there, but probably not for me. Space overall was very inviting. I got the tuna sandwich while bf had the gouda and ham. We also split an apple pie and bacon sammie. Sandwiches took a tad long to come. Since we were close to all the action, we saw some confusion amongst the servers, so that was unpleasant. We finally get our orders and they messed up boo's sandwich. However, the lady was nice and offered to box that one up, as she gave us the correct order, so we got a free sandwich. I enjoyed the tuna and everything tasted fresh. I like that it was a little different and had some string beans in there. The ham & gouda was pretty good too, as with the butternut squash soup. The apple pie & bacon one was quite yummy and not overly sweet, but definitely more a dessert imo. I also very much enjoyed the accompanied potato salad. Overall, I really enjoyed the place itself. Sandwiches were pretty good, but think there are betters options here, in which we would like to try. Definitely interested to see their new location on Halsted.

Such a cute place! Decorated like something from down south with a bit of class. I had a number 3 green juice, really good and oh so fresh. I also had the gouda and shaved ham sandwich, in place of the original Brie and ham, to be honest I wasn't too fond of it, mainly because of the Dijon mustard that I was told was actually a fruit jam, but I guess she just confused it with the old sandwich. My friends were highly satisfied with their meals. I'm going back to try something else, somebody that likes Dijon would have probably really liked the sandwich. Definitely give this place a shot. You'll be happy you did!

Who doesn't love Blue Door? After hearing about it over and over for months, I finally stopped by with friends for brunch. The location is great (right off the Armitage brown line stop), the place is quaint and adorable, the staff is friendly, and the food is wonderful. I had the Brown Line Wrap: Wheat Tortilla, Scrambled Eggs, Havarti Cheese, Bacon, Oven Roasted Onions, Red Bell Peppers. It didn't seem like anything special on paper but it was so fresh and you could tell that the vegetables were roasted with care. The havarti cheese with the eggs was delicious! My friend had the Sesame Chicken Salad and I caught her eating the dressing with a spoon. So I'm assuming that was great. :) We hung around for another hour or so after we finished, which left us time to try their Almond Milk Lattes. I love that they offer almond milk! I will be back ASAP for the Fig and Arugula Grilled Cheese.

The lackluster service was accompanied by an ignorant staff. They were very impolite and didn't even offer to bring us water. I felt judged and un-welcomed, definitely a negative experience. If a "zero star" option was possible, that's what my rating would be.

Neat farm-to-table café/restaurant, great for lunch. I had the kale and shaved Brussels sprouts salad; my wife opted for the farro and arugula salad. Both were delicious. They only minor quibble is that I was expecting some kind of interesting bread to be served with salads, but only "side of toast" was available (and had to be ordered separately).
Nice food, but it felt like I should have been wearing suspenders and blasting The Decembrists while snapping a pic of my sandwich with a Polaroid.

I love this place! A lot of people raved about the cobb salad but I actually did not like it at all. However, the kale and brussels salad is awesome! The french tuna sandwich is really good too (if you like tuna). My favorite thing on the menu is the goat cheese and fig jam crostini. Great place for healthy eating!
I've never craved a salad before but I can't wait to get their kale and Brussels salad again. It's crunchy salty bacon and sweet creamy tahini dressing make this the best salad I've ever eaten.

This is in my hood and I visit weekly. I love the decor, good is above average, lattes could be better but want really needs work is service. It takes forever to get food!!!! I only go when I have plenty time to wait. Overall it's a good place but won't last imo if service doesn't improve. Also, would love some prepared foods for takeaway.

I could have gone to this place daily! Almond Milk Lattes? Fresh Chocolate Chip Cookies? Gourmet Tomato Soup and Fantastic Grilled Cheese Sandwiches?? I admittedly over ordered and still managed to eat it all. You can't go wrong!

I like this place.  I live in the neighborhood so it's convenient for grabbing a cup of coffee or a bite to eat.  I've also brought my laptop in to study/do work a couple of mornings.  Their breakfast wraps are good, I love that they're packed with veggies!  Their pumpkin grilled cheese is also amazing (it's off the menu now but hopefully it comes back in Fall 2015!).  The space itself is cute -- something you would find on Pinterest.  It gets super busy during lunch hour, and the strollers/huge groups of girls definitely crowds up the place, but it's a great spot.

Yes yes yes!! I went here on a whim with a friend about a week ago and I am impressed. Local ingredients, local ciders and beers, ams HUGE salads. Great homemade salad dressings as well.  The place is super cute, great for groups, and they serve your food on wooden cutting boards, how cute!! I ordered the Sesame Chicken Salad with a side of the blue dressing. Mmmm. My friend and I also split a gingersnap cookie and wished we had ordered two. I think that their juice is way over priced (9 to 11$) but what can you do. I would come here to eat again, or to just chill and drink coffee.

Blue Door Farm Stand has pretty good sandwiches. Their lattes however could use a lot of work. I went in with my mom and my sister. We ordered the following: -Roast Beef French Dip Pretty tasty to be honest. Very flavorful. The dip on the side provided a lot of extra flavor and moisture -Blue Door Chicken Salad Sandwich Not like your typical chicken salad. Still good but not exactly mind blowing. -Latte We ordered this with a pump of hazelnut. The entire latte was flavorless. I could neither taste the espresso or the hazelnut. Would definitely not order again. Total price: $28 All in all, incredibly overpriced. The Roast Beef French Dip sandwich was very tasty but it did not justify the price. It was $12 for a small sandwich with a tiny little tin of potato salad. I could not get over how bland the latte was. Overall this place is decent. It's very overpriced but the ingredients are fresh.

Great brunch/lunch spot. I got the grown up grilled cheese and lentil soup which was really good! The restaurant it's self is very cool. It is farm to table and everything is extremely fresh. The room is a little small and it is open seating so you might have to be patient.  This is definitely a place I would frequent for a nice fresh and healthy lunch!

Consistently good and a great spot for lunch. The grilled cheese is phenomenal and the salad menu has enough variety for any palate. Reasonable prices, especially considering the regional and seasonal sourcing. Love this place.

So I have to start by saying upon entering the atmosphere is very cute. They sell little jam jars and cute candles/lotions from local distributers but the food not so much, my mother got the lentil soup (that was alright) and a half tuna sandwich12$. I had ordered a chicken salad sandwich $10 that tasted smoky? nasty! ...I would not recommend that to anyone. After sending that back I had the turkey cheddar on wheat witch was fine but simply something I could make at home not something I would pay $10 for. On a scale of 1-10 I give the food a 4 only because the fried kale chips that came with my sandwich. We tried a cookie as well, was chocolate chip with sprinkles on top seriously again nothing special :(

Thank Jebus for this place. I live down the street and am tormented everyday by overpriced, unhealthy food (I'm looking at you, Summer House). The neighborhood really needed something that was affordable, healthy, and quick. The answer? Blue Door. I've tried everything from their salads, soups, sandwiches, and yes the occasional "slice" of carrot cake. If you've never had the carrot cake, try it just once, I double dare you. My only complaint is that this place is forever and always crowded (typically with strollers and blonde moms, as they can smell kale from 10 miles away). Overall a great experience and good value for the quality of food! Will continue to be a regular!
The purple line wrap is OKAY and a bit overpriced for what you get. Overall decent experience

The turkey cheddar sandwich is absolutely delicious! I will absolutely order that next time I visit. Clark and I both ordered Cobb Salads with a half sandwich...his the Turkey, mine the Chicken Salad. The Chicken Salad in a wrap was delightful...even with a bit of a kick to it, which I normally do not prefer. This was great! The Cobb Salads came in tiny little boxes, but when I put it onto a separate plate to mix it up, it ended up being almost a whole meal in itself. They certainly do not short you on take out salads! A little too much Bleu Cheese for my liking, but all I had to do was pick the large chunks out.  I love this place, but just wish it was slightly less expensive.

This place has extremely charming decor, which drew me in. But that's the best thing about it, in my opinion. It's supposedly very fresh, seasonal food, but it's still way over priced. $9 is too much for an all-veggie sandwich, which I didn't think was very good. BF wasn't impressed with his food either and I felt bad for choosing this place for a lunch date. Also, I ordered their housemade juice and was given an expired one. I returned it for another one and was given a 2nd expired juice. I returned it again and was given one with the expiration sticker peeled off. Shadey and annoying. We ordered two different juices and didn't care for either.

Located just east of the Armitage Brown Line stop, BDFS juxtaposes farm fresh eating with big city culture. For those who like their greens, the current menu features kale prepared four ways: baked with parmesan as a chip, combined with artichokes as a dip, as the base of two substantive salads and cold-pressed in green juice. The Brussels & Kale salad is a standout. On the sandwich front, the grilled cheese menu is so much more than its name suggests, and this season's flavors have the restaurant turning to pies for inspiration. The Pumpkin & Sage is BDFS's take on pumpkin pie, while Apple Pie & Bacon draws on its namesake's classic flavor. While BDFS is an ideal lunch spot, it also has a coffee, tea and juice counter that serves up beverages from two other Chicago businesses - Bow Truss Coffee Roasters and Harvest Juicery - making mornings a little better, too.

Today I chose to order to "take away." I live two blocks away and ordered via phone before heading to the restaurant. The person who answered the phone was attentive and knew the answers to all my questions. (I have a food allergy and he assured me that ingredient wasn't going to be in my order- which it wasn't) I ordered the Halsted with the Vegan Veggie soup- It was full of lentils, veggies (no peppers yaay) and quinoa. Very hearty and delicious on a gray day. (A bit on the small side but it is a combo so I was still happy.) My Halsted was finished off with the beet, spinach and pear salad. I was impressed with the large portion and enjoyed how fresh all the ingredients tastes. Even the apple cider vinaigrette was light and bursting with flavor. A perfect accompaniment to this salad.

Found this place on Yelp and decided to go there for a weekday lunch with a friend and I. I expect any restaurant to do a crowd at lunch, and this was no exception. However, we stood in line for upwards of 20 minutes before ordering. Be prepared to wait. They move at a snail's pace in everything they do. We also waited what seemed an unusually long time for the food to come. Do realize that some of this place (not all) is a communal seating concept, so if they are busy, you will very possibly end up sitting with strangers. We had some personal stuff to discuss over lunch, and had we known this, would have certainly opted for a different spot this time.  That being said, they have some really healthy offerings and the food was pretty good. I'd give the food 4 stars overall, so without all of the waiting, the review would get the same. I get the impression they are just a slow moving place in general, so as long as you aren't in a hurry, this is a good stop in Lincoln Park to check out.

This might be one of my happiest finds in Chicago and I'm thrilled I live so close to it! I had come across this place on a google search a while back, but it faded in memory for a while until my friend came to visit. We got here on a Sunday at 12:05 and I was so disappointed when I was shut-down for breakfast (which ended at 12). I don't blame them and it was silly of me to be disappointed by that. Fortunately, they rebounded so fast. I got the chicken salad sandwich and slice of pumpkin bread and I was in heaven! The whole cafe is adorable and such a cozy place to be. They have so many good bakery treats and a diverse menu that I'm sure you'd find something wonderful to eat. They also sell a lot of products from local artisans and the cafe is worth visiting for aesthetic comfort alone. We loved our experience so much that we came back the next day and finally got the breakfast I wanted. Enjoy!

I live about fifteen feet from this restaurant so I was really hoping after three horrible service experiences, the fourth time would be different. Sadly, I was let down again. My boyfriend and I came in to get some soup right after the morning rush. The restaurant was not even very busy. Everybody around us was done eating and gone before they even acknowledged that we had been waiting for over thirty minutes. The soup was good but definitely not worth this horrible service.

Service can really kill a place with fantastic sandwiches.  Second time visiting Blue Door after the first time I refused to come back for months only to show back up to receive the same level of service.   Only reason 2 stars were given because the sandwiches are good. With no wait in line, did this really have to be 1 hour dinning experience for sandwich and salad?

This place is SWIFTLY going down hill due to the customer service and management and it makes me sad so I'm writing a review to hopefully change the situation. I live around the corner and eat here all the time. Recently, there have been a couple of situations that literally, don't make sense to me. First of all, do not order soup as your entree at this place. Especially not to go. I ordered soup to go, which was 8 dollars, and received my small container of soup without bread. I asked if it came with bread and the manager said that it did not, that that is just something they have never done. I asked if it was possible to get some bread with my soup. He asked me if I wanted multigrain toast or a crostini. I said crostini, and he then asked me for $2.21. I literally thought he was joking. What kind of place charges 8 dollars for a bowl of soup and doesn't give you bread, crackers OR a spoon??? Offensive. I told him not to worry about it but that they should consider serving bread with their soup, LIKE EVERY OTHER RESTAURANT IN AMERICA, and he says, "Ok, thanks, have a good day!" Another time I ordered their most recent sandwich special, the avocado grilled cheese with tomatillo jam. It arrived, sans tomatillo jam. I asked one of the employees if I could have it on the side since it was missing on my sandwich. The same manager as the first incident came over and says, "Oh, we ran out of tomatillo jam 45 minutes ago!" I said, "Ok, but it kind of makes the sandwich. What you gave me is just a few slices of avocado and 2 pieces of mild cheese? I'm pretty sure the reason the sandwich is interesting is because of the jam." and he said "Yes, it's too bad." Clearly sensing I found this offensive, I HAD TO ASK if I could get something else instead. He asked me what I wanted and then replaced it. He apologized only when he brought the other sandwich, and very quickly. Another patron at a different table leaned over and goes "That guy is an asshole."  You can eat here, because the food is great, but GOD FORBID you have a problem or ask for anything additional or you will be made to feel like you are SO demanding. For a place with such high prices, you expect a little customer service. Not sure what's going on here but I hope this changes because this place was a great neighborhood addition.
Friendly staff, adorable place with great food. Kale and Brussels sprout salad was phenomenal!

I very rarely give 5 stars but this time, I truly believe Blue Door deserves it.  I just moved much closer to this gem and I must say I can't WAIT for many more dinners to come. I popped in about 20 minutes until closing time on a Sunday and the staff was extremely pleasant...last minute customers are the worst but I really wanted to try them out.  I knew in advance I wouldn't be able to decide easily so I went with "The Armitage" (half salad and half sandwich).  After suggestions from the employee taking my order, I opted for Brussels & Kale salad and the Fig & Arugula grilled cheese.  What I loved MOST of all was that after eating this I felt great...the grilled cheese isn't coated in grease.  It's solid, amazingly fresh flavors. There's quite a few things I want to go back and try on the menu...I do wish they were open later than 8pm however, that is one distinct flaw.  Perhaps they will consider expanding their hours to 9 at some point...
Top notch. All the way around. Very friendly workers. Cobb salad was huge and great. Sugar cookies were off the chain. Ambience is perfect. Very vegetarian friendly. I WILL be back.

Wish they had one in California. This place is amazing. So fortunate my friends live around the corner.  Was too late for breakfast so got the fig and arugula grilled cheese. So so so good. Simple, a little rich with the fig, and perfect.  Iced vanilla latte was also ridiculously good. Apparently they make their own syrups. Not too sweet at all, just right.  Girl working at the counter was also very nice. Can't go wrong with good food, coffee and customer service.  So happy to have chosen this place, and will be back tomorrow for breakfast!

I love the concept of Blue Door -- fresh, seasonal food from local farms. There's even a chalkboard on the wall showing exactly where your food came from. I came in for lunch with a friend and ordered the kale and brussel sprout salad with a cup of the soup of the day. The soup was amazing: fennel, sweet potato and chicken. The salad looked great but was very bitter. It could have used more dressing or seasoning to combat the bitterness of the kale and sprouts.  My soup and salad combination cost $10, which I thought was a fair price considering the quality of ingredients. I also considered purchasing one of the cold pressed juices until I saw that they cost the same as my entire meal: $9.50! I get that cold pressed juice is expensive but I'm a broke student and can't spend $10 on a beverage.

Wholesome, tasty, farm grown ingredients make this spot high on my list.  I enjoyed a half Blue Door Chicken Salad sandwich paired with half Citrus and Kale salad.  The chicken salad does have onions in it which I'm not a fan of, but the salad was very yummy.  Others in my group had the ham and Gouda sandwich, the cauliflower and squash soup and the Brussels and Kale salad.   Everyone was happy with their choices.  This is a order at the counter, then find a spot to sit place.   We arrived at 1:15 for lunch and found a table quickly.   We did have to wait a bit for the food, but it all seemed so fresh.   Would love to go back and try their juices or a coffee. They also sell some local made gourmet food items, gifts.  The restaurant is bright and happy with nice farm decor.  I would definitely return.

Short version: best grilled cheese and cauliflower soup I've ever had and super friendly staff. Long version: We stopped by on a Saturday at 6pm and it was fairly empty so we thought we were at the wrong place but people began showing up after we ordered and sat down (you order at the cashier and they give you these cute little blocks with your number on it). The place was so cute with this rustic farm vintage feel. My fiancé and I ordered the grown up grilled cheese, cauliflower soup, the Brussels and kale salad, and the kale and artichoke dip. The grown up grilled cheese was the best grilled cheese I've ever had. It wasn't too heavy on the cheese and it was sweet which I thought would be weird but was amazing!! The cauliflower soup wasn't overly salty like some soups can be and it had a ton of flavor. The salad was good but didn't blow my mind- the dressing was what made it really good. Places like these can be hit or miss i.e. the atmosphere is great but the food is bad or vice versa, but this place really had good food. We spoke to the manager Chauncey (sp?) on the way out and learned that they had opened Feb of 2014 and that they always change their menus with the season and the food. We will definitely be back! Tip: for the mothers and fathers out there, they have a koala kare changing station in the bathroom and have high chairs as well!
Was looking for a spot and this place was recommended by two different people in the neighborhood. The fig grilled cheese and maple kale salad were spot on. Friendly service too

Really love this place. Food is super fresh and portions are large. Salads are tastey-I'm a vegetarian and have really enjoyed both kale salads. Grown up grilled cheese is also really good! Decor is lovely and staff is friendly. Highly recommend if you are in the area, parking can be tricky but train is a close walk. A must go !

Awful experience!  Management does not care about people enjoying their dining experience.  This should not be Chuck E. Cheese #2.   If parents can not be responsible for their own kids running all over the restaurant then management should ask the parents to contain their children.  Literally there were at least 4 to 6 kids running back and fourth from the main dining area to the front door and playing with products on the shelves as well.  They were loud and disruptive.  My friend and I saw that there were many kids in the main dining area after we ordered so we sat in the front section where it was "quieter" The kids in the main dining area weren't sitting at their tables rather they were twirling around and playing.  So the only reason we sat in the front was for a quieter experience...only it wasn't.   I mentioned this to one of the workers who wasn't willing to do anything about it.   If you have little kids you can come here and let them do whatever they want and treat it like a playground.   If you would rather not be in a rambunctious atmosphere it's best to skip this place. And....I love kids.  They are great.  However providing the right type of atmosphere so everyone can have fun is management's responsibility.
Delicious food. Gorgeous decorations.  The menu selection is fantastic. Can't say enough good things about this place.  I am from central IL and I will be back !

This place!!! Who knew I'd find myself ever saying "I had the best salad of my lifetime!!" ??? Not this girl, but guess what? I had the best salad of my lifetime at Blue Door!! Not once but twiice! Brussel Sprouts and Kale. Omg. They got this said so right. It doesn't even sound appealing in the name but honestly, it is. They figured out the perfect mix of deessing, greens and other goodies. I liked it so much at lunch I actually ordered 2 to go. One for me and one for a friend who I knew would love it. Who craves salads?? I do now. Call me crazy but I actually crave that salad...so fresh and so delicious. I love that you can do a half salad with had soup or hard sandwich combo. The grilled cheese sandwich is super awesome and the perfect 1/2 with a salad. I brought my kids one day for lunch and they cleaned their plates. I have to mention the giant piece of carrot cake we saw being delivered to a table. Omg. It was as bug as my head and was ONE serving. There are so many things I need to go back and try at Blue Door!!!

This place is awesome! They use local farms for their ingredients, so everything is very fresh. They believe that the seasons should decide what they cook. I had their Caprese Grilled Cheese - it was really good! It comes with a side of potato salad, which is great, but the portion is pathetic. It basically comes in a one oz. shot glass. It's so good, so serve it in a bigger bowl or something!  I also got the sweet potato hummus, which comes with carrots and sweet crackers. I will definitely get it again - cheap ($7) and quality! They also sell various kitchen accessories, like cheese and cutting boards, utensils, books, etc. Another perk to this cute place is the staff. They're very friendly, and will offer advice if you're torn between options, or are just confused entirely.  Looking forward to going back here!
This is an awesome addition to Lincoln Park! Their veggie wrap and tuna salad sandwich are great! It is very family-friendly too.

Really cute and organic place that you would miss if you just walked by.  Their food is very fresh and they focus on farm to table ingridients. I had the smoked ham and brie with potatoe salad.  You could really taste the smokey flavor.  Only downside is that it is a little pricey. I paid $30 for 2 sandwhiches and 1 beer.

The place I'd dream to run in my own neighbourhood. Simple food but fresh and made with great ingredients, friendly staff, great decor and a lot of daylight ... On top of that, the best coffee in town!

I discovered this hidden gem a few weeks ago, and simply can't get enough. These people are doing everything right. Fresh ingredients, menu variety, incredible customer service, and a beautifully decorated space. It's a great place to get a cup of coffee (and zucchini bread) and work on your laptop, or sit with friends and enjoy a delicious.meal The people here are very nice, and the owner(?) frequently walks around and talks to the customers. You'll leave this place in a good mood and with a full belly!

Adorable! Such a gem. It looks tiny from the outside but opens into this airy light filled back room with beautiful wood tables, cute plants and pretty lanterns.  All food looks and sounds amazing.  Playing good oldies too!

We ordered take out from here and it was delicious. Fresh ingredients, delicious mix of tastes, generous portions. We ordered the Kale and Artichoke Dip appetizer, the Farm Stand Cobb Salad and the Citrus Kale Salad - they were delicious and we could not have enjoyed our meal more than we did. Kudos Blue Door Farm Stand! We will definitely be back here again!
