This place is legit. Feels like you're eating AT the farm. Highly recommend just about anything they do for breakfast and their Chicen Salad sandwich for lunch is maybe the best I've ever had. If I lived or worked closeby I would be here everyday. I hope it's here for years to come!
Love that this place is healthy and local.  One of the best kale salads I've ever had!

Stopped here for lunch while in lincoln park. I loved the atmosphere! The sky lights let in a ton of natural light and really compliment the rustic decor. My friend accidentally ordered off the kids menu, but my cobb salad was very large and big enough for two to share. It was delicious, and had the perfect amount of dressing. I'd definitely go back next time I'm in lincoln park.

Blue Door Farm Stand was bustling when I went for lunch on a Saturday. But with ample seating and plenty of staff, there was no worries of not having a seat. I decided to try one of the grilled cheese sandwiches, a sandwich I don't often eat. I went with the "Grown Up," which had gruyere, havarti, and swiss, plus basil and tomatoes and a rosemary honey. The sandwich was OK, really only OK, despite the terrific array of cheeses and bread from Red Hen Bread. The only flavors I really could taste were of the herbs, and the single, small piece of tomato was very flat. It's tomato season, and this is a farm-to-table themed place; how did I get a listless tomato?? Completing the nostalgic lunch, I got a cup of the tomato bisque. The soup was quite tasty. Lots of flavor, a bit of spice, and a terrific creamy consistency. I wouldn't have minded it being a little thicker, so that it stuck better to the bread of my sandwich. But the flavor profile made up for the light density, and I scraped out every last drop. The cafe itself has a bunch of other fun things to try: pastries, cheeses, meats, juices, coffee, and so on. I did not have any of those things today, though I will note with approval that they had Nordic Creamery butters and cheeses--a terrific brand. I think if I had time to go back before I left the city, I'd try a coffee, a salad, and a different full sandwich. I still trust that the meats and vegetables are fresh and high quality, I just was less than thrilled with my particular sandwich. Maybe I should stick to not getting grilled cheese.
I really like this place, they are just open back in Feb and they are really doing very good. Price is normal, and foods are really delicious.

Great restaurant, and affordable prices for the fully sustainable sourced food options. I went with a group so we tried a number of items. Charcuterie was delicious. So was the fig crostini Fig panini - do it. One of my favorites.  Ham and cheese - tasty go-to but nothing super unique Salads - Had the beet and arugula salads. Both were tasty and VERY fresh. My one beef is they were very leaf heavy, and light on the accoutrements. PLUS because the portions were SO generous (which was fab) you definitely noticed only having 4 beet slides in there :) Dessert - They were very kind to deliver the banana/nutella later on. Thanks for the great service! Would definitely come back. Loved the ambience and casual counter-style ordering.

I've decided that even though the logistics are sometimes wonky (really wish they'd get another register) the amount of times my boyfriend and I get excited for Blue Door's salads and chicken salad wrap means that they need 5 stars.  My boyfriend typically refuses to eat chicken salad, except I made him try a bite of mine and now he's always trying to steal half my wrap (in addition to his own!) I also love that if I need to pick up healthier feeling food they're an option. Still recommend dining in for hot food, which works better than carry out. Can't recommend the chicken salad wrap, kale & brussel sprouts salad, or cobb salad highly enough. They also have great customer service, so I don't really  mind that they still mess up my order 20% of the time. It's delicious.

Easily my favorite, rustic place in the entire city. Reminds a homesick country girl of home! The decor is rustic, typically with folk music playing. You grab your own silverware, cups, and water there, not much unlike Native Foods. I ordered the Grown-up Grilled Cheese and a side Citrus and Kale salad. The kale salad was crafted with love, the dressing perfectly complimenting the fresh fruits and vegetables. Produce is key at Blue Door - they take pride in many of their locally produced and delivered fruits and vegetables. In the salad alone, you can taste the quality. My sandwich blew my mind. Who would have though brushing the bread with rosemary honey would be so delicious? It was a sweet and salty combination to die for, a sandwich I'd honestly kill to replicate. So if you're a homesick country girl like me looking to get some local grub, come to this hidden little restaurant with a little blue door. Bask in the farm pictures. Listen to the folk music. Order the grilled cheese and bask in that country glory.

Nice soups and salads made with organic, locally sourced ingredients. The farmhouse decor is well executed and attractive but the lack of windows/sunlight makes it feel closed in like a casino. And, to be honest, I can't stand the street/neighborhood where Blue Door is located. I liked Armitage better 10 years ago when it was straight up girly/boutiquey. Today Armitage feels like Wicker Park creeping East. A hipster shopping district that takes itself way too seriously. Here's hoping Blue Door signs on with GrubHub so I can get it delivered.

This place is counter service. Had the French tuna sandwich, kale Brussels salad and the carrot cake with iced coffee. Everything was just really solid. The stand outs for me were the carrot cake and iced coffee. Cool casual rustic ambience and overall solidly good food!

I love the Brussel and kale salad but I noticed their salads went from around $9 to $11 now. They've been open, what, 6 months? Is it going to be $14 by January?? I thought their price point was appropriate when they opened, given that no one even brings you silverware to your table with the meal. Again... The salads are great. A few more dollars tacked on and it will make more sense for you to go to any number of farm to table places in 60614 with waiter service, better ambience, etc.

I absolutely loved it.  Loved it!  We were out shopping around North and Halsted, and got hungry so my friend recommended we try this, and what a great idea that was!   We split the grilled cheese with fig and arugula - holy smokes it was amazing.  We also split the brussels sprout and kale salad with the maple tahini dressing - WOW!  It was so so so good, and its like this giant huge mountain of a  salad.  Loved it.   It was a very "Lincoln Park" restaurant to me (sorry to sound like a snob). Lots of children, lots of strollers.  It was loud in there, and after we got boxed into our table by 2 giant stroller we decided it was time to go.  However, it wouldn't detour me from going back because it was really that good.

great addition to the 'hood.  i've been working around here for 6 years.  there are about 5 burger places and 12 mediterranean places, so it's refreshing to see something with tasty sandwiches and salads that's not whole foods. it is very lincoln parky.  lots of chicks who just got done working out or are stay at home moms.  lululemon threw up everywhere.  but i ain't mad at it - i just wanna eat. i ordered the armitage, which is a 1/2 salad, 1/2 sammy.  i chose the kale + sprouts salad which had bacon [important].  also, almonds.  and a tasty tahihi dressing.  it was TDF [to die for].  that's gonna be my go-to fo sho.  the fig + goat cheese grilled cheese was deece and as much as i like figs and sweet stuff, it was a bit too much.  easy on the spread, bro. serve yo'self - order at the counter, grab free water and a rolled up napkin with your utensils.  water in etsy type water jugs.  cutesy.

This place is absolutely amazing. I found this place on yelp and just expected it to be a good ole sandwhich shop but this is like no other. There's a real home-y vibe, everything is painted white and blue, and there's even mason jars to drink water with.  I'm not sure of her name, but the girl who worked there explained to me how Blue Door operates, and it's all locally imported stuff, along with a changing menu that corresponds to the season! How often do you get that??? I got the fig and arugula sandwhich (amazeballs) along with a salad (forgot the name) but it had shaved brussel sprouts and a maple tahini dressing. It was the  bomb.com .  This isn't your typical panera. It's an infinite amount of times better. Everything is extremely fresh and tasty. It's quite healthy also. I didn't feel morbidly obese or bad about myself. It is a little pricey, but all and completely worth it! Definitely and absolutely will return!!!
The Blue Door Farm Stand is excellent. The food and coffee are delicious. There's not much else to say. Everybody who works here is awesome. The food is awesome. You should go.

Went for lunch and the interior design is quite nice. Everyone is very friendly and it has a "help yourself" kind of attitude. The food was very good. It is smaller portions by regular standards, but that's good! It's a perfectly sized lunch. I had a combo sandwich and soup fare, and the corn poblano pepper chowder was delicious. The salads look amazing and very big! So yes the food is really good! Downfall is price. It's very expensive. Word of advice: don't order drinks. I got a little juicebox of chocolate milk (yes the same one you get at the store) for $2.25! And a tiny tiny bottle of Coke was $2. Get water.

Delicious! Great breakfast wraps and chocolate chip cookies! Downside of the breakfast wrap was there was no bacon on it although bacon was listed as an ingredient. They also have a great selection of sauces you can buy. I highly suggest the chipotle ketchup!

Awesome. I got the beet salad and arugula and fig grilled cheese and was I heaven. Super fresh and light. Also massive carrot cake hit the spot light not loaded with sugar and tons of nuts and raisins. Great lunch spot with friends or even alone :) will definitely come back to try more. Also saw they have juice bar and smoothie options as well as a small kids menu with healthy options!
Absolutely delicious!!! Very fresh and healthy. Recommend the carrot cake as a treat!

Checked out the place for the first time yesterday. Its really cute! Very casual and open. Had the fig and arugula grilled cheese. If I go back, I will have a hard time ordering anything else but. I don't why I can't think combining things like fig and arugula and grilled cheese but perhaps that is why I don't have a restaurant. Its a perfect combination and salty and sweet and somehow refreshing. Enjoy :)

This place is super cute and good but pricey! Everything tasted super fresh and the salad I got was pretty large but not that amazing for the price. I would definitely go back to try something different and mostly because the decor is so quaint. The staff was a little slow and I was very confused about silver wear, I sat there thinking they would bring it to me since no one directed me to it as I left the counter, but for next time I will know!

Love all the Kale salads!! Sandwiches are fantastic too.  It gets 5 stars for what it is fantastic locally sourced soup, salad, sandwich and speciality food store/ restaurant. So nice to have this place in Lincoln Park.

Just finished my first visit to Blue Door - very pleased - tried "The Halstead" (BD's version of a "pick two"), with a half of the Turkey & Aged Cheddar sandwich and the "petit" size of the  Brussels & Kale salad.  The turkey was fresh, the cheese, apple and bell pepper preserve were REALLY good and the lightly grilled multigrain bread was AWESOME (OK - it's out there - I'm a bread man....), but the best part of the meal was the Brussels & Kale salad - it had slivered almonds and a whisper of bacon with a maple tahini dressing - the combination of it all together was unforgettable.  It feels like I may be acting a little too over-effusive for what seems to have become a "trendy" menu item but it was REALLY good - try it for yourself!  Looking forward to going back!  Oh - by the way - they have bacon brownies - just in case you were feeling too healthy after you finish your lunch - skipped it this time but I'll be ready for it the next time!

I have mixed feelings about this adorable, delicious, yet rather quirky cafe, so I will start this review with the highlights, and then explain further for those of you who may be interested. The Good: Breakfast Wraps--perfect size, incredibly fresh, and satisfies my cravings for a sinfully delicious egg, cheese, and bacon breakfast while wrapped in wheat so I can feel like I'm only eating 200 calories.   Chicken Salad--literally to die for.   Considering the raving compliments I always hear from fellow diners, the rest of the menu items are probably just as delicious. The Quirky: The décor is exactly what you would expect from a café named The Blue Door Farm Stand (TBDFS) nestled between the many high-end shops on Armitage Avenue--cute and rustic.  The menu is simple, relatively affordable, and seems to feature farm-fresh ingredients.  At the same time, it definitely caters to the people (women?) who can afford to shop up and down the Armitage/Halsted area.  I wouldn't consider this a bad thing, but there are certain things that they do that just do not seem to fit (see below). The Frustrating: Breakfast Wraps--I found out the hard way that they stop serving breakfast at 10:30 a.m.  I work second shift, and was soooo excited when this place opened up around the corner because there is a serious lack of breakfast food in this area.  After this initial disappointment, I continued to try to get my hands on one of those delicious wraps, once running in at 10:31 a.m., another time calling at 10:29 a.m., but both times I was completely turned down.  Seriously, are you a cute, fresh, and classy café on Armitage Ave., or are you a McDonalds drive-thru??  Definitely not a McDonalds, because a McDonalds employee would at least offer some french fries.  The staff at TBDFS will just give you a look that says "Sorry! You're SOL".  They lose a star for this. Aesthetics--While I appreciate the rustic theme, wooden tabletops can get really icky if they are not properly wiped down.  I moved away from a honey-laden table only to find ones with crumbs stuck in the crevices.  I brushed away the crumbs with a tissue I had in my purse (TIP: napkins and silverware must be picked up at the bar by the cream & sugar--they will NOT bring you any).  I'm pretty sure the bussers watched me do this, but they never came to wipe it off (again, is this McDonads??).  On a related note, the staff is extremely friendly, but not always as helpful as I wish they would be--I came here 3 times before I found the napkins.  I wish I could only dock a half star, but because some of the functionality aspects of this restaurant really bother me, I'll have to take a star.  Conclusion: All in all, this place is great and you should give it a shot.  I was really hoping that this would be a place that I could work into my daily routine, as the price is reasonable for an area lacking in cafés, but the logistics of TBDFS make it function better as an occasional stop rather than a regular treat.

Came by for dinner tonight; here's what I can tell, based on the clientele, the other reviews, and the chalkboard:  if you are a small female, or a male with a small appetite, and no matter what your gender you support the fresh/free-range/organic/natural market, then I think you are gonna love Blue Door.  Lots of great salad options, a few different sandwich/wrap options, cheese board selections and a wide range of desserts that appear to be made in-house.  There's a big space in the back plus the small seating area upfront, so lots of room...there's even a Goddess and the Grocer-style shop to buy items if you are on the run. I tried the Grown-Up grilled cheese sandwich...and that's my main criticism of Blue Door.  For $8, I got a pretty average grilled cheese sandwich, on some pretty tasty bread (Red Hen provides the bread, according to the menu) with something that added a little something special, which I learned later was a rosemary honey on the cheese.  The other ingredients were tasty but not mind-blowing.  But the SIZE of the sandwich was a joke.  I wish I was kidding about this, but after I had my sandwich and a bag of chips, I went to Brothers Beef nearby to pick up an italian beef.  I would say the Grown-Up was basically appetizer-size for a dish in Chicago. Now, again--if you are smaller, or come in not that hungry, OR come in for lunch (probably the best way to experience Blue Door, since they close early for dinner anyway), I think you'll be fine.  Just don't bring your 6'4", 230-pound former linebacker friend to Blue Door, as he will probably leave hungry, or angry, or hangry.

Yummy! Nutella and Banana Sandwhichs - seriously. They are to die for. I also love thier chicken salad. I order that on greens instead of as a Sandwhich. The kale chips are great too. Customer service has always been very good. We order Togo each time. Very good.
I love the Cobb salad. such a cute and friendly atmosphere. everything here puts me in a better mood!

Excellent addition to Armitage Street! Stopped in last night while strolling down Armitage looking for a place to eat dinner with one of my girlfriends.  This place is adorable and the food was excellent (I had the Armitage; half a grilled cheese and the cobb salad). Every single employee was friendly and helpful which made it an even more pleasant place to dine at.  Only complaint is that it closes at 8:00 pm which makes it hard for those who eat late dinners.  They were really nice and let my friend and I stay and chat while they were cleaning, so we didn't feel like we were getting "kicked out" because they were closing:)  Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a casual place to grab a bite to eat and want some healthier and fresher options.

In most cases, I will avoid going to Lincoln Park at all costs. In this case, I may find myself trying to talk every dining companion to meet me here. Such tasty, creative, light, FRESH sandwiches we had as carry out into Park West tonight. Chicken salad, veggie wrap (best I've ever had, REAL vegetables, not weighed down by oils and you could taste what each one was), and turkey sandwich, along with a cheese board and tasty kale chips made for perfect step above your run of the mill sandwich shop. Raspberry crumble was not my favorite dessert of all time, but not worth losing a star over. :) Online ordering for take out was a great convenience too!

Great spot for a local farm to table style lunch. I think they still have some kinks to work out on operations of busing the tables and getting food out. I think they should probably make it more clear that you should try to have someone in your party hunt a table down if it's busy and you are waiting in line. Go for the kale & brussel salad, even my boyfriend who avoids overly healthy things at all costs loved it. We split this and the turkey sandwich and it was the perfect amount without being too full. We also tried a cranberry scone while we waited and that was delicious as well.  Excited to come back and try breakfast items.

I needed a place to grab a quick, and relatively healthy, lunch on Saturday when I was shopping in Lincoln Park, so I went on my Yelp app and searched for the closest highly rated lunch spot.  Blue Door came up, and sounded perfect to me. I had the half portion brussels sprout and kale salad and half a ham and gouda sandwich.  The salad was delicious, I love shaved brussels sprouts, and there was a good proportion of sprouts, kale, nuts, and cheese.  The sandwich was perfectly fine, I just preferred the salad much more than the sandwich, so I would recommend getting a whole salad instead.  T he only thing that was frustrating was that I had to wait for silverware for quite awhile because it is self serve, and Blue Door wasn't keeping up with demand, so as soon as they put a few sets out, diners were grabbing them quickly and I had to wait multiple "rounds" of silverware being set out.  It sounds like this restaurant is fairly new, so I'm sure this will be sorted out soon. The map on the back wall shows where many of the ingredients come from - which I loved. Great lunch place!

Excellent place! The salads and sandwiches are wonderful, so are the yummy crostini appetizers.  You can tell everything here is very fresh and farm to table as their name says.  The interior is shabby farm chic with very pretty light fixtures and country music playing, which is awesome!! Can't wait to come back, wish I lived closer!

Been here often since this spot opened.  I was sorely needed in the hood and provides a nice take-away alternative.  One mini complaint is they haven't quite gotten consistency down yet, one day the carrot cake is to DIE for, the next week its got chunks of coconut in it.  The blue cheese walnut spread is always delicious, but tastes different each time.  With these bugs fixed I am sure they will be a neighborhood fav for years to come!

Went with my husband and two kids. LOVED the decor!! Beautiful tables, loved the chalkboards with the menus and loved the little plants in each table. I had the turkey and cheddar sandwich wich was really good. My husband had the tuna salad sandwich and it was amazing! For dessert we all had alfajores, in my opinion a little too much orange, but hey, if it has dulce de leche you cant go wrong!

The sandwiches are delish and the atmosphere is PERFECT for a classy casual lunch - French country meets Brooklyn - but the service was pretty lacking. We waited way way too long for a couple of sandwiches in a nearly empty restaurant. I plan to go back and hope they've worked out the kinks!

Love this new Lincoln Park place. I went in one morning and had a great breakfast burrito. The chef gave me a taste of the potato salad and I can honestly say I have never had better. The salads are amazing!The staff are great and the ambiance is cool and quaint, simultaneously. The retail section has delectable locally sourced jams and such. I liked it and have been there twice already this week:)
Loved the kale brussel sprout salad. It's not a huge menu but each dish is interesting (and sound delish). I'll be back for that Gouda ham sandwich and carrot cake!

I love the atmosphere at Blue Door Farm Stand.  They put out fresh flowers on every table and everything is very clean and homey.  I've had the Brown Line Breakfast wrap and it's awesome.  Also love their cafe latte.  Staff is awesome-very friendly. They have their portion sizes figured out too...you don't leave feeling overly stuffed.  You leave feeling healthy :)  I would try it out, especially if you live in Lincoln Park, or can easily get to the Brown Line. :)
Very fresh and high-quality ingredients.  Atmosphere relaxed and inviting.

Blue Door is definitely going to catch and become more popular, I would stop in now while there's no wait! Came in on a Sunday morning with Sunny H. for some grub. I do wish Blue Door had some more breakfast options, but we ended up going with lunch. The restaurant is located in a very convenient spot on Armitage in an old house. The interior is decorated so well, like straight from Pinterest. They even have a map in the back outlining where all of their food comes from which is so cool! Sunny and I ordered at the counter and sat down to wait for our food. I have one complaint and reason for my deduction of a star. We waiting a reeeeeeally long time for two sandwiches. I think they might still be working out the kinks and not have enough runners, but we were both feeling very impatient by the time our food finally arrived. Blue Door's menu has a plethora of very appealing sounding items. While we waited, we saw large, colorful salads going by, and hearty-smelling soups. Sunny and I decided to share the turkey/cheddar sandwich on multigrain and the chicken salad. The turkey was fresh and the sandwich was melty and so tasty! The cheddar was tangy as well as the preserves on top. The chicken salad sandwich was even better. The chicken salad itself was smokey and phenomenal! I can't wait go to back and have this again. Both of our sandwiches came with huge kale chips that had some parmesan sprinkled on top, such a nice touch!  Overall, I can't wait to come back to Blue Door. The interior is really pleasant and their menu is full of locally sourced items that sound fantastic. Definitely recommend as a lunch option in the area!

The decor is adorable - the fresh herbs on the table definitely set the atmosphere. They also have a cute retail section where you can buy special jams, sauces, cute plates, etc. I stopped in for lunch, so I had the turkey and cheddar sandwich and it was sadly pretty underwhelming. The highlight of the sandwich was the apple and bell pepper preserves (which was fantastic). Outside of the preserve, it was a standard, run of the mill turkey sandwich. Also, the kitchen also lost my order so I had to wait at least 5 minutes for my food after my friend got hers. However, my friend ordered the chicken salad sandwich and hers was fantastic! Full of flavor and a surprise of dried cherries. I had a bite of hers and I'll go back just to order my own!  I think they are still working out some of the service kinks, but I look forward to stopping in again.
Brussels sprouts and kale salad! Amazing! And I don't eat kale unless it's in a smoothie. This dish changed that! Perfect lunch spot!

I loved it I loved it I loved it.  Really though, I loved it. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the natural service kinks they have to work out, as well as the acoustics in the place (so noisy!) But aside from that the food was DELICIOUS. I split the kale and brussels sprout salad as well as the turkey sandwich and it was great. The salad may be one of the best in this "healthy" genre.  Also, the servings are GENEROUS for the price.. Just $9 for a fresh, big salad.  I so look forward to seeing the new menu as the seasons change!

Visited blue door today for the first time and was impressed! I had the turkey and aged cheddar which was delicious. My boyfriend ordered the tuna salad sandwich which was giant and very delicious! Sandwiches are served with kale chips..I could have eaten 100 of those :) My only complaint was how long we waited for 2 sandwiches...could have been a bit faster. Overall, I would definitely recommend blue door and I will certainly go back!

I like the decor especially the lightings. Staff were friendly and food was good but felt like few items on the menu were little pricey. I like that they serve intelligentsia coffee which is one of my favorite coffee. I really enjoyed the kale chip! I would eat that everyday if I can!

Came back today to try something new on the menu. I had the Blue Door Chicken Salad on a wheat wrap with a cup of the potato and roasted chicken soup. The chicken salad wrap was phenomenal!!! The flavors are very well colaborated together. As far as the soup, I expected it to be a tad more creamy. The chicken kind of sunk to the bottom of the cup. Again, the soup was a tad on the salty side. I'm looking forward to going back to try something else delicious on their menu.

Great first visit to Blue Door. Ordered a Cobb salad and the ham sandwich. The bread was amazing and the salad was huge and satisfying. I will go back for sure. So happy to have it in the neighborhood!

I loved my first visit to Blue Door. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The food is great and fairly priced--large portions, fresh and great presentation. I had soup and petit salad, my friend had a sandwich. It was the best sandwich he'd had.  There are 2 issues I can point out.  A minor one--the menu boards are on three walls. The food board is behind the counter, the drink board is closer to the entrance on the opposite wall, the soup board is at the end of the counter on a different wall.  The more annoying issue is you leave smelling like smoked bacon and the grill. They need a better exhaust system. I've experienced this at other cafes in Chicago. I certainly would take the food to go  if I needed to return to work or be somewhere important after the meal. I still smelled it in my jacket and hair late that night.

The decor is so adorable and it was vey roomy. The staff seems ,for lack of a better word, exhausted. We went on a Friday at lunch time. I heard the cashier say she hadn't had a day off in 2 weeks.  I could tell. We asked for extra crostini and it took a while. I wish they had fountain drinks..although the little diet cokes were cute..they were not big enough and pricey. The mason jar water was a nice touch. I will  go back again because the atmosphere was good and I look forward to trying different foods. I liked the retail items offered.
Undifferentiated menu. Understaffed and very slow (15 min for two takeaway sandwiches), albeit at peak Sunday lunch rush. Well designed and executed farm house interior. Extremely limited "grocery".

The place itself is a great space, it is very quaint.  The chalkboards and mason jars are cute and the blue wall panels are perfect.  The fig and goat cheese crustini was delicious, as was the ham and gouda sandwich.  My boyfriend ordered the turkey sandwich which was pretty good too, but I definitely preferred the ham and gouda :)  Their samples of their caramel popcorn were also great.

Their food was amazing. The service and everyone working there were very kind and attentive to all of our needs! Cannot wait for them to get their wine and beers in! Super excited to have them on Armitage in LP.

Love blue door, I've already been a few times and have been very happy with everything except one thing. I think they cut the onions out in the open kitchen and my eyes have been irritated every time I'm there as well as whoever I am with.  The salads are huge and awesome, the staff is very nice, and the cookies are uber good!

Wonderful layout in the back. Surprisingly plenty of room for small groups. We ordered the turkey grilled cheese sandwich and kale chips which was nothing but tasty. In addition we ordered the fresh kale salad. It was so good we got to meet the chef that prepared it and told us how is he went about putting together such an amazing creation. What i would do though is shy away from the sweet potato the hummus as the graham crackers they were served with was not the best match. All and all it was a great experience and We will be back!
Very nice staff and super cozy atmosphere. The coffee and breakfast specials are delicious!

My friend and I decided to check out this newly opened sandwich shop that was featured on PureWow!  We visited the shop on a Tuesday afternoon after hoping the brown line from the loop.  Walking down Armitage, I realized that this place fits right in, however there is little curb appeal as we walked past this shop two times!   Upon entering the secret door, two other pedestrians were curious what we were walking into and joined us for a look.  We were greeted by a quaint store in front that offered various farm fresh spreads, and treats for purchase.  We browsed for a bit, but quickly made our way to the counter - we were greeted by a display of delicious treats that; cookies, croissants, and of course carrot cake.   We decided on two sandwiches, each splitting the half's so we could optimize our tasting.  The French Tuna Salad sandwich was great.  The tuna was like what you would find on most gourmet tuna sandwiches, however it was the fresh red peppers and artichoke hearts along with the green beans that really sealed the deal.  We also ordered the Smoked Turkey, which again, Blue Door was able to offer fresh twist on an simple sandwich, each ingredient adding an awesome touch - especially the blue cheese.  The turkey was sweet, and was amazing all on its own and the arugla and grilled onion added an amazing balance.  As a nice compliment, each sandwich came with homemade baked kale and Parmesan cheese chips --- worth the trip alone!   For desert, we opted for the Carrot Cake, which accordingly the Chef, was 6 years in the making.  The cake itself was amazing, the frosting was on the buttery side; I prefer a little sweater, but this would not stop me from ordering it again!

Love it here! First off, the decor is adorable. They also have a retail section where you can take special jams, sauces, and other treats like that to go.  I've had lunch here a few times and have really loved everything. The kale and brussel sprout salad is amazing, as is the veggie wrap. The adult grilled cheese is also fantastic if you feel like treating yourself. Speaking of treating yourself, try the carrot cake! You won't be disappointed. Anyways, the staff is always super friendly and the food is delicious. Prices might be a little high, but you are getting local, fresh items and great service, so I think its okay to pay a dollar or two more. Its a great addition to the neighborhood and I suggest you check it out!

Blue Door has to be one of the cutest places to enjoy a great lunch or dinner and even to enjoy a cup of coffee. For one, Blue Door is extremely cozy with retail available, ranging from blueberry bourbon to kitchen decorations, all made locally. The ground coffee and espresso  is from Intelligentsia, so you know it is high quality. There is also an option of soy milk. The juices they make are cold-pressed. They are beyond delicious and refreshing.  All the ingredients for the salads and sandwiches are locally grown and fresh, which can be seen on a giant chalkboard map on the wall, showing the various farms they originated from. The salads and sandwiches are made to order, allowing you to modify if needed. I highly recommend the kale and brussel sprout salad and the grilled cheese. I have yet to try the soup, but there is always a vegetarian option, and they are made daily.There is also a kids menu, including a pb&j, made with almond butter. The chocolate chip cookies and carrot cake are amazing. All in all, I highly recommend this place. Prices are definitely reasonable for the quality of food ($7-10). The service is extremely friendly, and the food is even better. It is perfect for Lincoln Park!

Stopped here for an almond milk latte on my way to work. It was perfect. They use Intelligentsia for regular and Colombe for decaf, and I truly think this will become my new coffee spot. Really friendly service. There are some cute retail items at the front too. And a giant 3-layer homemade carrot cake that I absolutely will try next time I go...
Just stopped in for lunch. The food is excellent. Had the grilled cheese, carrot cake and cold pressed farmer's special that really hit the spot.

This place is super freaking cute! Has a great rustic feel on the inside and they serve drinks out of mason jars - which I am always a fan of :) I did the half sandwhich and cup of soup for $8 option. I had the cauliflower and cheddar soup - YUMMY! I just wish there had been more of it! For my sandwich I had their AB&J (almond butter and jelly). It was delicious, but I felt a bit foolish paying what I did for it, when I could have made it at home - but oh well! I work less than a block away on the weekends - so I am sure I will frequent this location for a fresh option :)

Just stopped the Blue Door Farm Stand on my way home from work.  This is a great new addition to Armitage Street.  The staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful and the food was great.  We will definitely be back.
